result.execSummary:
The defendant Carietta C Finch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carietta C Finch in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Carietta C Finch.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 


AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant ordered to serve 120 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 2 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and childcare, . Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/28/2022.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Complete 20 hours of community service.
- Complete a behavior modification course.
- No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
- Complete a firearm safety course.
- Defendant is to obtain and maintain fulltime employment. 
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/28/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept
- Court denies expungement. 
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Carietta C Finch in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Carietta C Finch appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea and sentencing date.  
Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carietta C Finch in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Parties advised Effective July 30, 2022 this case will be reassigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15, Room 623.  
Court ordered case adjourned. This hearing will held Remotely streamed Live through dacast - Via Zoom.
  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
RUBY DE LEON, received and filed.
Pre-trial conference on July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (7/1/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Carietta C Finch in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-29-2022 @2:30p
